definition: adj. 短暂的，转瞬即逝的
example: Fashion is ephemeral.

definition: n. 机缘巧合，意外发现珍宝的运气
example: Finding the cat was serendipity.

definition: adj. 有弹性的；有恢复力的
example: Cats are resilient.

definition: adj. 一丝不苟的，非常仔细的
example: Meticulous cleaning.
Photos bring back nostalgia.
Smartphones are ubiquitous now.
Measures were taken to alleviate the traffic congestion. (采取了措施来缓解交通拥堵。)

definition: adj. 模棱两可的，含糊不清的
example: The instructions were too ambiguous to follow. (这些指示太模棱两可，无法遵循。)

definition: adj. 连贯的，条理清晰的
example: Candidates need to present a coherent argument in the essay. (考生需要在文章中提出连贯的论点。)
Air quality has deteriorated rapidly in the city. (城市的空气质量迅速恶化了。)
There is a slight discrepancy between the two reports. (这两份报告之间存在细微的差异。)
Vegetable prices fluctuate according to the season. (蔬菜价格随季节波动。)
There is a strict hierarchy within the company. (公司内部有严格的等级制度。)
The new policy will be implemented next month. (新政策将于下个月实施。)
Bonus payments provide an incentive to work harder. (奖金提供了更加努力工作的动力。)

definition: adj. 不可避免的，必然发生的
example: Change is inevitable in a growing organization. (在一个成长中的组织里，变革是不可避免的。)
The exact mechanism of this disease is unknown. (这种疾病的确切发病机制尚不清楚。)
Globalization is a phenomenon of the 21st century. (全球化是21世纪的一种现象。)
These diseases are more prevalent among young children. (这些疾病在幼儿中更为普遍。)
He is a leading proponent of renewable energy. (他是可再生能源的主要支持者。)
All evidence was scrutinized by the police. (所有证据都经过了警方的仔细审查。)
The theory was developed subsequent to the earthquake. (这个理论是在地震之后发展起来的。)
We need to find a sustainable solution to this problem. (我们需要为这个问题找到一个可持续的解决方案。)
We need tangible evidence before taking action. (在采取行动之前，我们需要实质性的证据。)

definition: adj. 可行的，望能成功的
example: Is solar energy a viable alternative to oil? (太阳能是石油的可行替代品吗？)

definition: adj. 脆弱的，易受伤害的
example: Old people are particularly vulnerable to the flu. (老年人特别容易感染流感。)
He decided to abandon the sinking ship. (他决定放弃那艘正在下沉的船。)
Competitors must abide by the judge's decision. (参赛者必须遵守裁判的决定。)
She has the ability to manage complex projects. (她有能力管理复杂的项目。)

definition: a. 变态的; 反常的
example: The test results showed abnormal levels of sugar. (测试结果显示糖分水平反常。)
Many people fought to abolish slavery. (许多人为废除奴隶制而斗争。)

definition: a. 突然的; 粗暴的
example: The meeting came to an abrupt end. (会议突然结束了。)
She noticed his absence from the meeting. (她注意到了他缺席会议。)

definition: a. 绝对的; 完全的
example: I have absolute confidence in her. (我对她有绝对的信心。)

definition: vt. 吸收; 吸引...的注意
example: Plants absorb carbon dioxide from the air. (植物从空气中吸收二氧化碳。)

definition: a. 抽象的; n. 摘要
example: Truth and beauty are abstract concepts. (真理和美是抽象的概念。)

definition: a. 荒谬的; 可笑的
example: It is an absurd idea to go out in this storm. (在这种暴风雨中出门是个荒谬的想法。)
The country is abundant in natural resources. (这个国家自然资源丰富。)
Drug abuse is a serious social problem. (药物滥用是一个严重的社会问题。)

definition: a. 学术的; 学校的
example: He has a strong academic background. (他有很强的学术背景。)
The car started to accelerate to overtake the truck. (汽车开始加速以超那辆卡车。)

definition: n. 通道; 入口; 接近的机会
example: Students need easy access to library resources. (学生需要方便地获取图书馆资源。)

definition: vt. 提供住宿; 容纳
example: The hotel can accommodate up to 500 guests. (这家酒店最多可容纳500位客人。)
Children under 12 must be accompanied by an adult. (12岁以下儿童必须由成人陪同。)
She accomplished her goal of becoming a doctor. (她实现了成为医生的目标。)

definition: vi. 相一致; n. 一致; 谅解
example: His account of the event does not accord with the facts. (他对事件的描述与事实不符。)
Dust began to accumulate on the furniture. (灰尘开始在家具上积聚。)

definition: a. 准确的; 精确的
example: We need an accurate estimate of the costs. (我们需要对成本进行准确的估算。)
He was accused of theft. (他被指控偷窃。)
It takes time to accustom yourself to a new climate. (适应新气候需要时间。)
They finally achieved a breakthrough in the negotiations. (他们终于在谈判中取得了突破。)
He refused to acknowledge his mistake. (他拒绝承认错误。)

definition: vt. 使熟悉; 使认识
example: Please acquaint me with the facts of the case. (请把案情告诉我。)
She managed to acquire a good knowledge of French. (她设法掌握了很好的法语知识。)
It took him a while to adapt to the new environment. (他花了一段时间才适应新环境。)

definition: a. 充分的; 足够的
example: We have adequate food for the trip. (我们有足够的食物供旅途使用。)
The tiles adhere to the wall very well. (瓷砖粘在墙上很牢固。)
Our farm land was adjacent to the river. (我们的农田紧靠河边。)
The kitchen adjoins the dining room. (厨房与餐厅相连。)
You can adjust the height of the chair. (你可以调节椅子的高度。)

definition: vt. 执行; 管理; 治理
example: The fund is administered by a board of trustees. (该基金由理事会管理。)
She has a job in hospital administration. (她在医院行政部门工作。)
I admire her for her courage. (我钦佩她的勇气。)

definition: n. 允许进入; 承认
example: Admission to the museum is free. (博物馆免费入场。)

definition: vt. 承认; 准许...进入
example: He admitted that he had made a mistake. (他承认自己犯了个错误。)

definition: n. 青少年; a. 青春期的
example: Adolescent problems should be taken seriously. (青少年问题应受到重视。)

definition: vt. 收养; 采用; 采纳
example: They decided to adopt a child. (他们决定收养一个孩子。)
She adores her grandchildren. (她非常疼爱她的孙辈。)

definition: n. 成年人 a. 成年的
example: The film is suitable for both children and adults. (这部电影老少皆宜。)

definition: vi. 前进; 进展vt. 促进
example: Technology is advancing at a rapid rate. (技术正在飞速发展。)

definition: a. 高级的; 先进的
example: This is an advanced course in English. (这是一门高级英语课程。)
The main advantage of this system is its speed. (该系统的主要优点是速度快。)
Life changed with the advent of the computer. (随着计算机的出现，生活发生了变化。)
She told us about her camping adventure. (她告诉了我们她的露营奇遇。)

definition: a. 不利的; 敌对的
example: The drug is known to have adverse side effects. (已知该药有不良副作用。)

definition: vt. 提倡; 鼓吹 n. 提倡者
example: He advocates a reduction in military spending. (他提倡削减军费开支。)
